page.title: 07Housing in Woburn
page.content: Apart from a few modern houses, the {Bedford Estate}still owns the majority of houses in Woburn. The style is predominantly{Georgian}although there are a number of{19th century estate {cottages.}The quality of the buildings is such that the{Council for British {Archeology}have included Woburn in its list of important historic towns. Many of the houses owned by the Duke bear the Bedford Cipher. Many of the modern houses have been built in keeping with the Georgian character of the village. The attractiveness of the village is enhanced by the many hanging baskets and the cobbled Market Square.
